title: 107_hr4966
content:
The Act is titled the "National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Act" and defines key terms such as Administration, function, office, Secretary, and Under Secretary. It also outlines the organization of the Administration. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, under the Department of Commerce, has primary missions including providing hydrographic and geodetic products, conserving marine resources, and exploring the oceans. It consists of components like the National Coastal and Ocean Service and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Research Service. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) consists of various components including the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Research Service, National Marine Fisheries Service, National Weather Service, National Environmental Satellite and Data Information Service, and the Office of Marine and Aviation Operations. The Administration performs functions previously vested in it or its officers, employees, or offices, unless otherwise provided by law or redelegated by authorized officials. SEC. 4. UNDER SECRETARY FOR OCEANS AND ATMOSPHERE. The Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere is appointed by the President with Senate approval and is responsible for managing the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, general management, policy development, budget formulation, and resource allocation. The Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere is responsible for managing the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, including resource allocation, program management, personnel administration, contract administration, procurement of services, and external affairs. SEC. 5. ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR OCEANS AND ATMOSPHERE.

There shall be an Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere appointed by the President with Senate approval. The Assistant Secretary will be paid at the rate of basic pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule and will perform functions as prescribed by the Secretary or Under Secretary, acting as Under Secretary when necessary.

SEC. 6. DEPUTY UNDER SECRETARY. SEC. 6. DEPUTY UNDER SECRETARY.

There shall be a Deputy Under Secretary for Oceans and Atmosphere appointed by the Secretary. The Deputy Under Secretary will advise the Under Secretary and Assistant Secretary, ensure policy implementation, and act in their absence or vacancy. SEC. 7. GENERAL COUNSEL.

There shall be a General Counsel in the Administration appointed by the Secretary, subject to the President's approval. The General Counsel will be the chief legal officer for all legal matters related to the Administration's functions. In the Administration, there are Assistant Administrators for Coastal and Ocean Services, Oceanic and Atmospheric Research, Fisheries, Weather, and Environmental Satellite Data. They are appointed by the Secretary based on qualifications in background and experience. Each Assistant Administrator and the Director appointed by the Secretary must have the background and experience to oversee their designated functions under the authority of the Under Secretary. SEC. 9. PROGRAM SUPPORT.

Authorized appropriations for fiscal years 2003-2007:
- Corporate services: $80,000,000
- Facilities maintenance: $13,000,000
- Environmental compliance: $2,000,000
- Energy management: $550,000
- Marine services: $75,000,000
- Fleet planning and maintenance: $13,027,000

SEC. 10. CONTINUATION OF SERVICE.

Individuals in positions under this Act can continue until a successor is appointed.

SEC. 11. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS AND REPEALS. SEC. 11. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS AND REPEALS.
- Amends Section 5315 of title 5, United States Code to include Deputy Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere.
- Repeals Reorganization Plan Number 4 of 1970 without affecting the functions of the Administration under section 3(d).
